FAQ.answer: Yes, each item of the BOQ can have different delivery periods depending on the Project/Buyer requirement.

FAQ.question: I am getting an error message “Buyer is allowed to enter data up to H column only. Please add details in the relevant columns only ”.
FAQ.answer: You have added Data that has to be filled by the Seller/Bidder. Check your BOQ excel sheet, make corrections and then Upload the file.

FAQ.question: I am a Registered Buyer of GeM, is it possible to send Tender Publish notification to Sellers providing any specific category-based selling of products closer to the products to be procured through BOQ based bidding?
FAQ.answer: Yes, a Buyer may select any three categories closest to the category available in GeM to allow notification of Tender Publish to those Sellers who have put their products in display under such Buyer defined categories.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer, I am using BOQ based bunch bidding. The estimate price reflected during bid creation is that of the catalogue-based product selected. Can I possibly change the estimate price?
FAQ.answer: Yes, you shall be able to change the estimate price by clicking on the Edit price button during bid creation.

FAQ.question: I am a registered Buyer of GeM. Can I change the estimate price in BOQ based bidding?
FAQ.answer: Yes, a Buyer can change the Estimate Price in BOQ based bidding as the Price reflected is not captured from the catalogue selection. In case of bunch bids along with BOQ, the price is reflected in estimate value for such products picked up from the respective catalogue’s, again changeable.

FAQ.question: Where shall the Seller specification & supporting documents be shown to a Buyer for Evaluation.
FAQ.answer: A Buyer shall be able to view Seller compliance to specifications/supporting documents during Technical Evaluation stage as View Seller documents.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer, can I possibly seek clarifications for any documents/specifications put up by a Seller?
FAQ.answer: Yes, Buyer can seek Clarifications during Technical evaluation for any of the documents put forth by the Seller.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer, can I negotiate with the L1 Seller/Bidder?
FAQ.answer: Provision for online L1 negotiation can be exercised by individual Buyer keeping in mind the GFR Rules 173 (xiv) of GFR 2017. Buyer has to select one choice from any four choices available in the bidding system or the reasons for which negotiations are being sought. Uploading a document from the competent authority is Mandatory.

FAQ.question: How many attempts does a Buyer have to exercise negotiation with L1 bidder?
FAQ.answer: Buyer can exercise L1 negotiation up to 5 attempts.

FAQ.question: Do I have to calculate the Total price/value to be offered for the BOQ items.
FAQ.answer: No, unit price (all inclusive) is to be filled in the BOQ excel sheet. System auto calculates the Total Price/Value.

FAQ.question: What is the size of File that can be uploaded in BOQ based bidding for adding Specifications?
FAQ.answer: File size up to 25 MB can be uploaded by the Buyer, mentioned in help icon 'i' besides choose file.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer, when do I exercise the L1 negotiation option.
FAQ.answer: L1 negotiation option can be exercised during any of the below mentioned conditions:  1.Procurement of proprietary items. 2.Items with limited sources of supply. 3.Items where there is suspicion of a cartel formation. 4.Where CVC guidelines not applicable & proposed negotiation is governed by Rules/guidelines of respective Buyer organization.5.Other-Buyer to mention genuine reason.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer; do I have to upload any Mandatory/Compulsory document for initiating negotiations.
FAQ.answer: Yes, Competent Authority’s Approval is mandatory for initiating negotiations.

FAQ.question: What is the duration for which the Negotiation Window is open for the Seller to respond?
FAQ.answer: The time duration allowed for the Bidder/Seller to respond is 72 hours.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer, the L1 Seller has rejected my L1 negotiation request, can I re-send the negotiation request to the seller?
FAQ.answer: Yes, a Buyer can exercise his privilege to negotiate L1 price as many as Five times.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer. Do I get to see the status of L1 negotiation request sent to Seller?
FAQ.answer: Yes, Buyer gets to view details pertaining to L1 negotiation in the Negotiation Request Summary. Price history is also available to the Buyer in this Panel.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer, is there any specific format provided by GeM for uploading an undertaking certificate by the Buyer?
FAQ.answer: Yes, right below the Reason for negotiation TAB a download option for format is available to the Buyer. Click on the same, download & fill in the details then upload the file again.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer, is L1 negotiation feature available for schedule wise Evaluation?
FAQ.answer: Yes, L1 negotiation is available for all types of evaluation methods namely Total value wise, Item wise, Item wise consignee wise, Group wise.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer, is L1 negotiation available for both Products & Services?
FAQ.answer: Yes, L1 based negotiation is available for both Products as well as Services.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer & creating a Service Bid with a floor price for a particular category. I am unable to exercise L1 price negotiation button?
FAQ.answer: The floor price provided by you has been reached. Since prices cannot be below these floor prices L1 negotiation option not available.

FAQ.question: I am a buyer, I have add ons with unit price for services. The floor prices for only add ons has reached but not for unit price. Shall I be able to go for negotiations with L1 bidder?
FAQ.answer: Yes you shall be able to do negotiations with L1 bidder.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer, I have add ons with unit rate. The floor price of unit price has reached but not for addons. Shall I be able to do negotiations with L1 bidder in such an event?
FAQ.answer: No L1 negotiations in such case is not possible Only when floor price of unit price has not been reached negotiation window with L1 is open during such time.

FAQ.question: Can a Buyer add/type the same Item Title against Column 'B' in the BOQ Excel Sheet?
FAQ.answer: No, Duplicate Item Title is not possible , please add/type unique Item title against the column 'B' only while uploading the BOQ Excel sheet on the Gem Portal.

FAQ.question: What is the configurable Milestone payment for supply on selection of ICT(Installation, Commissioning & testing)?
FAQ.answer: Milestone based payment for supply on selection of ICT can be configuered between the range of 70% to 90%.i.e If 70% is selected then Payment Terms for Supply-shall be 70% payment pro rata basis on receipt of material & balance 30% payment shall be applicable on completion of ICT within 10 days from CRAC(Consignee Receipt Acceptance Certificate) or as defined by the Buyer{as per Organisation Type}Payment Terms for ICT- 100% on completion of ICT within 10 days from CRAC or as defined by the Buyer{as per Organisation Type}

FAQ.question: Is it mandatory for the Bid estimated value to be displayed in the Tender document?
FAQ.answer: No it’s not mandatory to display the Bid estimated value in the Tender document. Buyer may configure whether to be enabled or not be selecting the relevant option as Radio button ‘Yes/No’ during Bid creation-Step ‘Bid details’ stage.

FAQ.question: Which Buyer organisations can use limited tendering functionality?
FAQ.answer: CPSE buyer only.

FAQ.question: What is the maximum number of sellers for which bid participation can be restricted in limited tendering?
FAQ.answer: Buyer can restrict the participation of upto 100 bidders.

FAQ.question: How can a buyer select/restrict the participation of a particular bidder in limited tendering?
FAQ.answer: Buyer will have to mention the GeM seller id of the bidder during bid creation.

FAQ.question: Can buyer extend the Bid/RA if number of participation is less than 3?
FAQ.answer: Yes, the Buyer can extend the Bid/ RA in case number of participation is less than 3. The extension is possible before opening the technical bid.

FAQ.question: What needs to be done if there are more than one L1 in bid and buyer has proceeded with RA. On opening the RA, "no participation found" message is appearing ?
FAQ.answer: In such cases, Buyer will have an option to further extend the RA for participation. In case of a RA deadlock, Buyer will have an option to select a L1 seller from Bid results and proceed with the award. Alternatively, Buyer always has a provision to cancel the Bid/RA and re-initiate a new Bid.

FAQ.question: Is it mandatory for a Buyer to notify upfront that the Bid will be converted to RA, post technical evaluation?
FAQ.answer: Yes, it is mandatory to notify during Bid creation that the Bid will be converted to RA.

FAQ.question: On opening the financial, there is a tie for L1 position. Can I award the Bid to any of the L1 sellers?
FAQ.answer: No, in case of a tie, Buyer has to mandatorily go for RA.

FAQ.question: At which stage after opening a Bid can a buyer convert it to a RA?
FAQ.answer: During Bid creation itself Buyer has to upfront declare if the Bid will be followed by RA. This can not be changed after bid publication / opening. After opening the financial Bid, Buyer has to mandatory "Proceed to RA" if selected "Bid to RA". If not selected initially while creating bid, it can not be enabled subsequently at any stage.

FAQ.question: Can a buyer return to a Bid and opt for creation of an order, after he/she has already published the RA?
FAQ.answer: No, after publishing the RA, the buyer will not be able to create an order before RA completion.

FAQ.question: Can a Bid with a single participant be changed to RA?
FAQ.answer: No, a Bid with a single participant cannot be converted to RA. There should be at least two Bidders for competing in Bid to RA.

FAQ.question: Can technically disqualified sellers participate in Bid to RA?
FAQ.answer: No, only those sellers who are technically qualified for a particular Bid are eligible to participate in Bid to RA.

FAQ.question: In case of Multiple L1(S) in base of Bid or Bid to RA or Direct RA how the system does work?
FAQ.answer: In case of Bid (Forced RA where multiple L1 Bidders present) or in Bid to RA or Direct RA after RA Multiple L1(S) exist, after repeating another round of RA, Buyer now gets an option to select L1 Seller & award the Contract to such Manually selected L1 via System on GeM Portal.

FAQ.question: What happens if more than one Bidder is at the same Price level during Bid where Buyer is forced to Create a Reverse Auction (RA), yet the RA ends without any Participation?
FAQ.answer: The Buyer needs to select one of the Two Options provided to him. 1. Cancel the Bid.2. Proceed to select Manually the L1 Bidder from among the various L1 Bidders by clicking on the button 'Select' of the column from Technically Qualified Bidders.

FAQ.question: Can I change my decision of Manual selection of L1 Bidder in case of Multiple L1 Bidders when none have participated in the Reverse Auction (RA)?
FAQ.answer: Yes, Once selected a particular L1 Bidder, another Bidder can be re-selected for awarding the contract multiple times until the point wherein Buyer has not clicked on the button 'Submit & Proceed'.

FAQ.question: Is Input Tax Credit (ITC) based Financial Evaluation selection Mandatory?
FAQ.answer: No, ITC selection is not Mandatory. Buyer gets an option 'Yes/No 'to select ITC based evaluation during Bid creation. If Buyer selects 'Yes' Buyer can input the ITC Amount in Percentage for GST & GST Cess.

FAQ.question: What is the Range of Input Tax Credit (ITC) selectable by a Buyer?
FAQ.answer: The Range of ITC selectable in Percentage is from 0 to 100%.

FAQ.question: Is the Input Tax Credit (ITC) Percentage Amount selected displayed in the Bid Document in Public View?
FAQ.answer: Yes, the amount of ITC benefit in Percentage is displayed in the Bid/Tender document published.

FAQ.question: In case L1 Bidder is an unregistered GST Seller, who is accountable for the Payment of Tax liability?
FAQ.answer: In the event of Procurement of Goods from unregistered Sellers, the Tax liability falls on the Buyer Provided Buyer is notified Under Section 9(4) of GST.

FAQ.question: What is the Unit of Measurement for GST Cess amount for ITC Selection?
FAQ.answer: GST Cess(GST Cess) amount incase of ITC Selection is in Percentage.

FAQ.question: What is the Unit of Measurement for GST Cess amount for RCM Selection?
FAQ.answer: GST Cess(GST Cess 1) amount incase of ITC Selection is in Percentage so also incase GST Cess(GST Cess 2) in quantum is Absolute Value.

FAQ.question: Can Splitting& MSE/MII be selected for Input Tax Credit (ITC) based calculation in Financial Evaluation Ranking System?
FAQ.answer: Yes, If Buyer opts for Splitting, MSE/ MII; System will proceed with the Price match based on Total ITC applied on the Price of L1 Bidder.

FAQ.question: W.r.t RCM,In case I happen to Select 'Notified under 9 (4) ' as 'NO' & Opt for 9(3) what is the consequence of this selection?
FAQ.answer: As a Buyer you shall select 'No' if not notified under section 9 (4) but opt for categories where RCM is applicable as under section 9(3) then GST & GST cess shall not be an input text for the Seller during Seller participation. The types of Seller under consideration are as mentioned below: 1.Registered Seller who have Opt to choose out of FCM(Forward Charge Mechanism). 2. Sellers who are not registered under GST.3. Sellers under composition Scheme.

FAQ.question: What is the minimum duration allowed for RA and what is the maximum number of auto extensions allowed in RA process ?
FAQ.answer: The minimum duration allowed for RA is 1 days. Auto extensions can be configured by the Buyer anywhere between 10 up to Unlimited times.

FAQ.question: In case of a single participation in RA, can buyer proceed with order creation?
FAQ.answer: Yes, single participation in RA is valid and buyer can proceed with order creation.

FAQ.question: What is RA offer Validity (from End date)?
FAQ.answer: RA Offer Validity is the period during which Seller Offer is valid from the RA End Date. The Buyer needs to award the Order within the RA Offer Validity Period.

FAQ.question: How is the benchmark price determined for RA?
FAQ.answer: The price of product/service selected by the buyer from the market at the time of RA creation is set as benchmark for the RA. Buyers are suggested to select the most appropriate product/service for RA creation.

FAQ.question: What is the duration of technical offering in RA?
FAQ.answer: The duration of technical offering in RA is between 10 and 21 days.

FAQ.question: What is the duration of financial offering in RA?
FAQ.answer: The duration of financial offering in RA is between 2 and 5 days.

FAQ.question: How many extensions are allowed to the buyer in financial offering of RA?
FAQ.answer: Maximum three manual extensions are allowed by the system in financial offering and a single extension cannot be of more than 2 days.

FAQ.question: What if the RA option is not visible on checkout page?
FAQ.answer: For services in which a minimum price capping has been configured , RA option will not be available since there is no scope for further price reduction.

FAQ.question: Is splitting available in RA?
FAQ.answer: No, splitting is currently not available in RA. Splitting option is only available in Bid.

FAQ.question: Is it possible to extend RA?
FAQ.answer: Yes, a buyer has the option to extend RA. It can be extended further provided the bid end date is within bid life-cycle.

FAQ.question: What is RA auto extension?
FAQ.answer: If a seller participates in the last 15 minutes of RA end time, the system will auto extend RA by 15 minutes. The number of extensions will be as per the buyer’s selection i.e. a minimum of 10 UPTO Unlimited times. Any RA price submission after the RA end time will not be recorded

FAQ.question: What are the various inspection methods available for a consignment?
FAQ.answer: Consignee can either inspect the consignment him/herself or get it done by a professional agency.

FAQ.question: Can a buyer select the L2/L3/L4 seller bypassing the L1 seller during Bid Awarding?
FAQ.answer: No, a buyer cannot select the L2/L3/L4 seller bypassing the L1 seller during Bid Awarding.

FAQ.question: Is seller consent required for cancellation of contract?
FAQ.answer: Seller consent is not required in transactions where the delivery date is already expired. However, in cases where the delivery date is not yet over, seller consent is required for cancellation of transaction.

FAQ.question: What is the the time frame for providing consent by the seller regarding cancellation of contract?
FAQ.answer: Once the buyer raises a request for cancellation of contract, it will automatically be reflected on the Seller Dashboard. After that the seller gets 5 calendar days to accept the cancellation. Post expiry of the duration, request will be auto-declined and the contract will still remain valid.

FAQ.question: In case of contracts with multiple products, can a buyer cancel the order?
FAQ.answer: Yes, a buyer can cancel contracts having multiple products.

FAQ.question: Would the seller be able to generate the invoice for a contract, if the cancellation request is pending for seller confirmation?
FAQ.answer: No, the seller would not be able to generate an invoice for a contract till the cancellation request for that contract is pending for seller confirmation.

FAQ.question: If the delivery period (DP) of the contract is over, will the buyer be able to cancel the contract on their own or need to send the request to GeM for the same?
FAQ.answer: In case the delivery period (DP) is expired and invoice is not generated, the buyer can cancel the contract.

FAQ.question: Why is the contract date different from the sanction date in my order?
FAQ.answer: After filling the financial details during the order process, the buyer has to e-verify the contract for creating the order. If any buyer does not e-verify and leaves the e-verification page and comes back after few days for e-verification, then the contract pdf new date would override the old date. However, sanction pdf date would remain same.

FAQ.question: Is the invoice generated on GeM, a valid GST invoice?
FAQ.answer: No, Invoice generated on GeM is not a valid GST invoice. Sellers should provide a valid GST invoice, if demanded by Buyer. Additionally, GeM invoice would have the reference of the seller's Invoice number and Invoice date.

FAQ.question: Is a GeM invoice certified for making payments?
FAQ.answer: Yes, GeM invoice is certified for making payment through GeM. However, the print out of the GeM invoice is not valid for making payments.

FAQ.question: Can the Buyer claim GST input credit basis the GeM Invoice?
FAQ.answer: For GST purpose, the seller has to provide a proper GST invoice along with the delivery of product(s)/service(s). Please refer GeM GTC clause 8 (iv) (d) for more details.

FAQ.question: Can a buyer cancel the contract?
FAQ.answer: Buyer has the option to Decline Demand, which does not require seller consent. This option is available with the buyer right from the time of submission of the financial approval document till the order has been accepted by the seller. Once the order has been accepted by the seller, the buyer can initiate a cancellation request, which goes to the seller for consent.

FAQ.question: How many days the seller has for responding to order cancellation requests raised by the buyer?
FAQ.answer: Seller has 5 days to respond to the buyer's order cancellation request. In case, the seller does not respond in 5 days, the order cancellation request gets auto rejected.

FAQ.question: Can the buyer cancel the contract after the delivery period has expired ?
FAQ.answer: Buyer can initiate a cancellation request immediately after the delivery period has expired, in case no invoice has been raised by the seller. For such a request, no consent is sought from the seller and the order gets cancelled straight away.

FAQ.question: Can a buyer cancel the contract after an invoice has been generated ?
FAQ.answer: In case the seller has generated the invoice, the buyer gets the option for order cancellation after 15 days of delivery period expiry of the order, only if no PRC has been raised. For such a request, no consent is sought from the seller and the order gets cancelled straight away.

FAQ.question: How can Buyers Increase/ Decrease quantity for a Bid order?
FAQ.answer: Buyers need to have the ATC clause selected at the time of bid placement to reserve a right to increase/decrease upto 25% of the original quantity before the contract generation and increase upto 25% of the original quantity after the contract generation.

FAQ.question: How can a Buyer decrease quantity for a contract, created from Bid?
FAQ.answer: Once a bid has been awarded, Buyer will have the option to edit the order quantity from Order Summary if the ATC clause has been selected in the beginning.

FAQ.question: Till when is a Buyer allowed to change order quantity?
FAQ.answer: Buyer can increase/decrease quantity until the contract generation. Once the contract has been generated, a buyer can only increase the quantity post seller acceptance of the order, until the order has expired.

FAQ.question: Can a Buyer add or remove consignee for the amended order?
FAQ.answer: Buyer cannot add a new consignee, but in case of multiple consignees, buyer can remove a consignee by making the quantity assigned as 0.

FAQ.question: By how much percentage can a Buyer increase/decrease order quantity?
FAQ.answer: Pre Contract - Buyer can request amendment for increase and decrease quantity till 25%, until the Financial Approval Submission stage at the time of order creation- Post Contract - Buyer can request amendment for increase in quantity till 25% until the DP has expired. Note: For Defence users, the amendment percentage is upto 50%.

FAQ.question: I am a Railway Buyer/Consignee.What type of verification is required to authenticate the following: 1. Contract Generation & Contract Amendment by Buyer. 2. CRAC Generation by Consignee.3. Bill Generation/Verification/Regeneration by Buyer, DDO
FAQ.answer: For the Mentioned Transactions, only e-sign & DSC option would be available to authenticate.

FAQ.question: Can a Buyer extend the Delivery Period of a Contract?
FAQ.answer: Yes, Buyer can extend the delivery period of a contract at any point of time post contract generation subject to the following:1) All contracts where Invoice has been generated by the Seller, Extension of the delivery period is not allowed.

FAQ.question: Is seller consent required for Extension of the Delivery Period?
FAQ.answer: Yes, Seller Consent is required.

FAQ.question: Can a buyer cancel the contract for which the seller has paid the Transaction charges?
FAQ.answer: Yes, The Buyer can cancel all such contracts provided the delivery period has expired. For Contracts within the delivery period, Seller's consent is required for cancellation.

FAQ.question: What is the the time frame for providing consent by the Seller for cancellation of contract or Extension of the Delivery period?
FAQ.answer: Once the Buyer raises a request , it will be reflected on Seller's Dashboard. Seller gets 5 calendar days to accept the request. Post expiry of the duration, request will be auto-declined and the existing contract will still remain valid.

FAQ.question: Would the Seller be able to generate the invoice for a contract, if the cancellation or Extension of Delivery Period request is pending for Seller confirmation?
FAQ.answer: No, the seller would not be able to generate an invoice for a contract till the cancellation or amendment request for that contract is pending for Seller confirmation.

FAQ.question: How can I enable GPA payment mode in my account?
FAQ.answer: HODs can go to the Payment Method tab under 'My Account'. After selecting GPA checkbox, HOD needs to validate their GPA number and IFSC code that they have received from the bank. Once the validation is complete, HODs can register their DDOs by mapping them to one of their validated GPA accounts.

FAQ.question: Who can Map multiple GPA accounts?
FAQ.answer: HODs can map multiple GPA accounts.

FAQ.question: Who is authorised to impose LD on Seller?
FAQ.answer: Buyer/PAO are authorized to impose LD on seller.

FAQ.question: What is the process of refund if the order is cancelled in GPA?
FAQ.answer: If the order is cancelled on account of non acceptance by Seller or the buyer is cancelling the order, the funds blocked in GPA will be automatically unblocked

FAQ.question: Who is authorised to make payment in GPA?
FAQ.answer: DDO/PAO is authorized to make payment in GPA.

FAQ.question: What is the process involved in GPA on boarding?
FAQ.answer: NPAE would need to open GeM Pool Account with GeM partnered bank. Once bank has completed the on boarding of NPAE in GEM portal, the NPAE can start operating the GPA.

FAQ.question: Which payment mode will be available to primary users for selection?
FAQ.answer: The primary users will be able to view and select payment modes depending upon their organization type.

FAQ.question: How can a buyer draft a bill?
FAQ.answer: The buyer needs to login to his/her account and from the dashboard click on bills. The buyer will be able to view all the contracts. He/she can click on the particular contract and draft the bill for the same. The bill is drafted based on the CRAC (Consignee Receipt & Acceptance Certificate).

FAQ.question: Who drafts the bill when the payment mode is CGDA?
FAQ.answer: Buyer drafts the bill when the payment mode is CGDA (CDA or UNIT).

FAQ.question: Who will process the bill after it is drafted by the buyer for PFMS payment mode?
FAQ.answer: The DDO will process the bill after it is drafted by the buyer for PFMS payment mode.

FAQ.question: Is PAO required, if the payment mode is Railways?
FAQ.answer: No, PAO is not required for processing the bill if the payment mode is Railways. The buyer drafts as well as processes all bills.

FAQ.question: How can I change the payment mode?
FAQ.answer: The primary users are authorized to change their payment mode. Once the primary user changes the payment mode, the payment mode will display to users i.e. Buyers/DDOs etc.

FAQ.question: Is the Auto Calculated Suggested LD binding on buyers ?
FAQ.answer: The Auto Calculated Suggested LD Value is a suggestion only and not binding on the buyer. The suggested LD field is editable and the buyer has the flexibility to change this suggested value as per his organization’s requirements.

FAQ.question: What is payment mode for Ministry of Defence?
FAQ.answer: Payment mode for Ministry of Defence is CGDA. There are two components in CGDA for making payment: 1. CDA (Controller Defence Account)2. UNIT payment by CDA - Online/Offline

FAQ.question: What are the different payment modes available in GeM?
FAQ.answer: Below is the list of payment modes currently available in GeM: • PFMS • IFMS • Internet Banking • GeM Pool Account (GPA) • CGDA for Defence Buyers • Railways for Railways Buyers• CRPF, Others.

FAQ.question: How much amount should be blocked for Product Order creation via GPA?
FAQ.answer: For Product Orders, 100% of the projected order value will be blocked at the time of order creation.

FAQ.question: How much amount should be blocked for service orders creation via GPA?
FAQ.answer: For Services Orders projected value of service order as per services billing cycle will be blocked at the time of order creation.

FAQ.question: How much should be the blocked Amount for Service Orders creation via GPA?
FAQ.answer: If the billing cycle is greater than 2, then the blocking will be done for the 2 billing cycles, else for the complete Contract amount.

FAQ.question: What is top up blocking?
FAQ.answer: Any service order which is created with PFMS, Challan, or Non-Challan GPA. Users will have to option to do the top-up the remaining billing cycles in order to process the bill and make the payment online.

FAQ.question: What is GPA?
FAQ.answer: GeM Pool Account is a special purpose bank account opened, operated and controlled exclusively by each NPAE (Non-Public Financial Management System (PFMS) Agencies/Entities) for the purpose of ensuring prompt payment to the sellers/service providers on GeM who supply goods/Services to the NPAE through GeM For Product Orders, 100% of the projected order value will be blocked at the time of order creation.

FAQ.question: I am a Buyer from organization ISRO, which payment method shall I choose?
FAQ.answer: ISRO’s ERP system is integrated with GeM Portal hence please select Payment Method as ‘ISRO’.

FAQ.question: What are the Payment method available for Indian Railway Buyers ?
FAQ.answer: The Indian Railway buyers bills are processed and paid by Railways Account Office. The Orders, Bills data were shared with Railways Accounts office through API integration for payment processing. There are three payment modes i.e. Railways Online Railways Offline Others

FAQ.question: What are the payment methods available for GeM Railway Buyers like Railways PSUs ?
FAQ.answer: GPA, Internet Banking, PFMS

FAQ.question: What are the rejection reason are handled online by Railway Buyers ?
FAQ.answer: Buyer related changes in bills are handled online like LD & Other Deductions etc. Change of IFSC code and Bank details are also handled online in returned bill cases.

FAQ.question: What is the final step for Railway buyers on GeM portal for payment of consignment ?
FAQ.answer: Buyers will prepare, generate and processed the bills for payment processing . Final Message shown to the Buyers after payment processing : “ Payment is in progress”

FAQ.question: What is CGDA Payment method ?
FAQ.answer: The payment method where buyers bills are processed by Controller General of Defence Accounts (CGDA) Office. The GeM bills data were shared with CGDA Server through the API integration.

FAQ.question: What is the final step for buyers on GeM portal for payment of consignment ?
FAQ.answer: Buyers will prepare, generate and processed the bills for payment processing . Final Message shown to the Buyers after payment processing : “ Payment is in progress”

FAQ.question: Can Buyer re-submit the bills on GeM portal rejected by the CGDA office.
FAQ.answer: Yes, There are 10 rejection reason which are handled in the system where buyer can re-submit the bills with new bill copy and supported document. The changes carried out by Service Provider/Seller in their profile will also be reflected in the bill copy like changes related to bank account details. Following rejection reasons are covered i.e.

FAQ.question: What are the rejection reason are handled online by Defence Buyers ?
FAQ.answer: Buyer related changes in bills are handled online like Financial Sanction not matching with that of supply order value , uploading of new sanction document etc. Change of IFSC code and Bank details are also handled online in returned bill cases.

FAQ.question: What is the minimum service charge allowed by GeM to service providers in case of Commission based services, such as Manpower Outsourcing Service, Security Manpower Hiring Services, Sanitation Services etc.
FAQ.answer: As per DoE OM No.F.6/1/2023-PPD dated 6th Jan. 2023, the minimum service charges for commission based services has been fixed as 3.85. Same has been implemented by GeM for commission based services.

FAQ.question: Who is responsible for GeM Organization – IFA mapping ?
FAQ.answer: Primary User of GeM Organization.

FAQ.question: What is the process for registration of IFA on GeM portal ?
FAQ.answer: IFA CGDA Admin

FAQ.question: Who will approve the proposals on GeM portal which will be taken with Higher CFA?
FAQ.answer: As of now, Primary User will take approval from Higher CFA offline and the same document will be uploaded on IFA and accordingly will take action against the proposal.

FAQ.question: How many stages of approval required for bidding procurement mode?
FAQ.answer: Two Stage, AON Stage during bid publishing and Expenditure sanction during Order checkout stage.

FAQ.question: Who will add the IFA sub-Users under IFA on GeM portal ?
FAQ.answer: IFA will add his subordinate on IFA module. User ID and Password will be pushed through Email and Mobile.

FAQ.question: Who can un-map the IFAs from GeM organization on GeM portal ?
FAQ.answer: Primary User of Organization

FAQ.question: Can CFA overrule IFA
FAQ.answer: Yes, Reasons for rejection should be recorded on GeM portal.

FAQ.question: Can SOC and Supporting document are uploaded with the procurement proposal.
FAQ.answer: Yes, Provision are given during L1 and Bid approval where user will upload requested documents.

FAQ.question: In the draft bid be amended based on IFA and CFA recommendations
FAQ.answer: Yes, Secondary Buyers can amend the bid basis on the recommendations.

FAQ.question: How many days IFAs are expected to concur the proposal
FAQ.answer: Four Days.

FAQ.question: IFA can map how many subordinates under him
FAQ.answer: 10 Users

FAQ.question: Can IFA-Sub User mark file to other Sub-IFA users under the same IFA
FAQ.answer: Yes
